the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
how night markets work as economic ecosystems
the science of sourdough starter cultures
why certain city intersections become cultural landmarks

formats.name: dialogue_duet
formats.instruction: Write a back-and-forth between two characters debating a single idea. Each character gets up to four lines, max. Give each voice a distinct tone.

formats.name: visual_imagery_prompt
formats.instruction: Describe a scene as if painting it with words—focus heavily on sensory details (color, scent, sound), avoiding any personal opinion or narrative. 60-120 words.

formats.name: time_capsule
formats.instruction: Write a message as if you're sending it 20 years into the future. Address someone unknown. What would you want them to remember or discover?

formats.name: emoji_chain_reaction
formats.instruction: Start with a single emoji, then create a chain of 5-7 short phrases—each phrase must relate to or riff on the previous. No more than 2 sentences per phrase.

formats.name: micromanifesto
formats.instruction: State a bold, personal belief or philosophy on something small. One paragraph, but make it punchy. 40-70 words.

formats.name: artifact_examination
formats.instruction: Choose a weird object or image found online and analyze it closely—guess its origins, speculate on its purpose, then invent a possible backstory. 180-350 words.

formats.name: journey_map
formats.instruction: Chart a progression of learning or experience in 5 distinct steps, each labeled. Each step should include a small anecdote or twist. No introduction.

formats.name: mini_myth
formats.instruction: Invent a folklore myth about something ordinary. One-sentence origin story, two sentences of 'legend', finish with a moral or lesson.

formats.name: wish_granted
formats.instruction: State a wish for the world, but then describe what could realistically go wrong if it came true. 1-2 paragraphs.

title_styles: Write a title as a mysterious riddle or puzzle—leave readers guessing.
Compose a title using a single bold statement or prophecy.
Write a question in the form: 'If X happened, what would Y look like?'
Make a title that starts with 'Imagine:' and sets a scene.
Use playful alliteration or rhyme in your title.
structure_variants: Organize your post as a series of contrasting pairs (pros/cons, light/dark, old/new).
Write the body as a letter to someone (real or fictional).
Present your content as a miniature script, with very short stage directions.
Break your post into three quick vignettes or mini-scenes, each with slightly different tone.
Structure as a countdown—start big, end small.
topic_angles: Hidden rituals or habits in daily life nobody talks about.
Invented traditions or celebrations for future decades.
Impossible-to-solve mysteries from the natural world.
Alternative versions of common technology—what if phones worked differently?
